steps.title: SautÃ© the aromatics
steps.step: In a medium pot, heat the olive oil (and butter, if using) over medium heat. Add the leeks, onion, celery, and garlic. Cook for 8â€“10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft and fragrant.

steps.title: Prepare optional vegetables
steps.step: If using zucchini, potatoes, and/or Chinese cabbage: place them in a **heat-safe mesh insert, steaming basket, or steel soup filter** directly in the pot. This allows them to cook in the broth without being blended later.

substeps.step: Add the optional vegetables to the pot and cook for 2â€“3 minutes, stirring gently

steps.title: Add seasonings and lentils
steps.step: Add the dried thyme, cumin, a pinch of salt, freshly ground black pepper, and the cooked lentils. Stir to combine.

steps.title: Simmer in broth
steps.step: Pour in the vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20â€“30 minutes, or until the potatoes (if using) are tender.

steps.title: Blend the base
steps.step: Carefully remove the mesh insert containing the optional vegetables and set aside. Using an immersion blender, blend the soup base until smooth. You may blend partially for a textured finish or fully for a silky result. Return the cooked vegetables to the pot.

steps.title: Add cream and lemon
steps.step: Stir in the oat milk (or cream) and lemon juice. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.

steps.title: Serve
steps.step: Ladle into bowls and garnish with parsley, chives, a swirl of cream or drizzle of olive oil. Serve hot with crusty bread.
